item.title: Setup a VM Server with Proxmox VE
item.description: Proxmox is a powerful, open-source virtualization management platform that allows you to create and manage virtual machines (VMs) and containers on a single server. It is a popular choice for home labbing, where enthusiasts use it to create and test different configurations of operating systems, applications, and network setups. In this article, I’ll guide you through the steps required to set up a Proxmox server for home labbing. Requirements A 64-bit CPU with Intel VT/AMD-V virtualization support At least 4GB of RAM (8GB or more is recommended) At least 16GB of storage space for the operating system and Proxmox installation At least one Ethernet port for network connectivity Setup Download and Install Proxmox Head over to the Downloads section on Proxmox’s site and download the installation ISO.
